values:
there ever was! 

i'm not used to being this optimistic. i'm in absolutely no rush, but i know i'll find someone to tell my secrets to. someone to tell, "your crazy, emotional needs give my life purpose." we can console each other for our beautiful craziness & idiosyncrasies that no one else will get to experience. yeah, that's going to be amazing. but, all in good time. with baby steps. 

now to re-learn this idiotic journal...

Today was my big interview.

My guest was a mortician.

Everyone took their places as cameraperson, director, assistant director, audio, stage manager, lights, switcher, etc.

And then...

I.
Kicked.
Major.
Ass.

Mr. Mann said that it was the best interview that he's seen all semester!

I was prepared, had great questions, great follow-up questions, great eye contact, great presence, I look good on camera... I think I'm going to be chosen for the very exclusive anchor spot in the Bronc News class next semester.

I know I'm a good writer, but this is something that is fun and challenging. It forces me to use my people skills and my writing abilities. This is the perfect job for me. And today I found out that I don't suck at it. Best feeling ever!

I'm looking into taking communication classes abroad. They're offering one in Paris (bliss!) and Brazil (hott!), among other places. Tomorrow, I'll go talk to Ms. Rangel. She's always really helpful. And she's pretty.

I have a bright future doing what I love doing. The only thing better than this would be to get paid to play with poodles and kittens all day long. But seeing as how that's not going to happen... this is great.

Now I just want this sleeping pill that I took to lose effect so I won't walk around zombified like I have been. 

I also would like some pizza. Or Italian food. Or to go to an Italian place and eat all of the above. Mmm!

To celebrate. And eat. And feel good.

A date with Catty-Cat will work, though!

<3

If someone can't see a good thing in front of them, they don't deserve to have it.

I love Casablanca.
I just wish Humphrey Bogart wasn't in it. That douche.
I would love to have been my age now in the mid-1940's.
I would love to be sitting in the sun, eating an orange, wearing a dress and red lips, thinking of a boy off fighting the Germans.

Catty-Cat is the best cat ever.

I think I'll sit and watch my Audrey Hepburn documentaries tomorrow.
I always end up crying from about midway to the end.
Always.

I've been looking foward to a lot a lot more often than I'm used to.
I like it.
It keeps me on my toes.

I love anticipaton.

The best thing to do is wait until the kitten's water bowl gets less than halfway empty, wait until she's not looking, and fill it up.
The next time, she'll stick her head in the bowl, expecting to drink water from below the halfway mark, and sniff and cough because she got water in her face.
It's the cutest thing.

My date with Nate was great.
A fun, 10 hour-long adventure.

Everything is going really well right now.
It's such a good feeling. A breath of fresh air.

The Minus the Bear show was great.
Russian Circles was super. I liked them a lot.
The bartenders made strong drinks.
Annalee and I are "BFF" now.
Eric asked me a weird question, and I don't know what to make of it.
Anthony was absolute perfection, like always.
It was freezing.
I made new friends.
I took off my double socks and showed off my supercute feet. 
I argued with Scott on whether American Sign Language is considered a foreign language. 
I got earaches.
I stood with Eric and watched Minus the Bear. 
They made me dance and happy.
Jess and Abbie are great.

I'm putting in my applications to ACC, UT, and Concordia for summer classes this week.
Maybe a temporary change in scenery will help.

Micha got Student of the Week. Yeah. Baby.

I'm going out with Nate tomorrow. He's taking me to one of my favorite places ever... the carnival! He promised to get on all the scary rides with me. I'm really looking foward to that.

Should I dye my hair dark?

The kitten is going to be the end of me.

The Good Life + me = ♥

I'm still debating over whether or not to go see Cursive. I want to, because I LOVE Cursive and Tim Kasher. I don't want to, because Happy Hollow is pretty much anti-Christian. The music is GREAT, but I'm not sure if I want to be in that kind of enviornment. I'll probobly end up going.
I'm going to the Blood Brothers and Straylight Run shows. For sure!
I would gnaw my foot off at the ankle for John Nolan. Hell, I'd do it for Michelle Nolan too.
That's going to be amazing!
I'll be at my happiest at that show.

I'm gonna go eat Taco Rico now.

Hey, I'm glad you're happy.

I get to see Antwone in a few hours!

And, hopefully, Antwone and I will travel to Corpus to see Leslie and Thomas this weekend.

But, first things first... I hope someone remembers to feed the kitten and poodles while I'm gone.

I was driving home at a little after 2 o'clock in the morning, singing along to Album of the Year by the Good Life (the most Sara CD ever to exist on Earth), and I smiled because of a song lyric. I was driving West on Nolana, where it gets really dark, except for the occassional street light, and as I passed one, I caught my reflection. I noticed that tonight, I had a really pretty smile. It was just a shame that I didn't use it much. Nothing's wrong. It's just one of those days, I guess. Anyway, I thought that since it's rare that I find myself even mildly pretty at all, I should take a picture of that smile. In my car. On Nolana. In the dark.

Then I got home, uploaded the picture, and decided that it wasn't that great after all, haha.

No worries.

Catty-Cat and I found a pill bug on my bed. I smiled for a second. Those crazy critters.

I'll have you know...

 

And I just might be...

 

I heart them so.

Austin on Wednesday!

<3

Please don't look too much into my previous post.

Shortly after writing it, I got my period, so all the insecurities, emotions, anger, and curiosities were explained.

Just sayin'.

Aside from the rare stomach cartwheel, I find it odd to admit that life is good.
Pretty damn good.
My family is superclose, like always.
The poodles are well.
Progress is being made in taming the kitten.
My circle of friends is smaller, but closer.
School is... fun.
My relationship with Anthony is really great. The distance isn't as daunting as it was. Maybe because we're both making greater strives at seeing each other. He's wonderful.
Life is good.

Lately, I've felt that even if things weren't going so well... if life were like it was a few months ago... I'd be okay. I would definitely handle it better than I did then.
Loneliness doesn't bother me as much. Codependency isn't as huge of a factor as it was.
I'm okay with me being my only friend. 
I'm glad that's not the case, of course, but I'm ready if it ever happens.
Friendships are fickle.
And I refuse to let my heart get broken again... it's been through far too much.
I'm in a good place, though.
And, for that, I am glad.

How did I get so lucky?
This has to be karma. 
I'm finally getting good vibes for all the shit that I've gone through.
Where does that leave him?
It's none of my concern, of course, but I'm just curious.
I wouldn't wish what he put me through on anyone.
Except him, of course.
Ten fold.

As the song goes, I'm glad for what I've got and done with what I've lost. 
And in case I lose my way, I've got my wonderful little bunch to help me find my way.

Take a good look...



'Cause this boy is absolute perfection in a human body. I swear it.

MINE!

The boy loves me.

He tells me why every single night.

In detail.

He's sincere.

And he says the perfect things.

He says I'm his ideal girl.

The boy loves me.

Now why can't I see it? And why can't I appreciate it? 
I pray that God lets me.

I'm such a stupid girl when you're around.

I am so damn gullible. 

It's disgusting, really.

You bring out the worst in me.

And I hate it.

I'm sick of you.

This is an amazing scripture:

 [ 2 Corinthians 12:9-10 ]

 "Now I take limitations in stride, and with good cheer, these limitations that cut me down to size [abuse, accidents, opposition, bad breaks, heartache]. I just let Christ take over! And so the weaker I get, the stronger I become!"

God, heal my heart. I can't do it alone. Help me to not be bitter or hurt. Stop my tears. Let me continue to love as you love. Do not let this stop me from caring for others. Give me the strength to carry on with a smile on my face. Please give me the grace to go about my days without thinking of failed relationships, and only look forward to the sunny days ahead. Amen.

Hugs, kisses, and trying to heal my heart, Sara

Anthony's birthday was this past Saturday.

And his birthday gift from me was this tattoo.

He's now one step closer to getting the sleeve that he wants.

This makes tattoo number three for him.

I get my number three tomorrow.

Hooray!


Hugs, kisses, and gettin' inked, yo, Sara

When I read that note in your mailbox, I got so sad and so scared and so angry, that I just stopped caring.

Even if it wasn't what it seemed, it made me realize a lot.

And that made me sad and scared and angry too.

Now I don't care if you're upset. I don't care if you're sad. I don't care if you're hurt.

Because you never cared when I was.

I never knew that I was so bitter.

You bring out the best in me. You bring out the worst in me.

And now... I think I really am done.

Steve Irwin died. 

Reading that made me so unbelieveably sad. 

I ran to my parent's room to wake them up and tell them. 

They were sad too. 

Gosh, I remember buying my dad a flashlight keychain for Christmas a few years ago. It had a plastic crocodile floating around in a tube of water and glitter. My dad liked it a lot. 

One year, a long time ago, we had just upgraded from cable to satelite. The first thing we watched was The Crocodile Hunter. 

Steve Irwin was part of the family. 

We all got happy and celebrated when both of his kids were born. 

And now we're sad that he died. 

My prayers are with his family. 


Hugs, kisses, and stingrays suck, Sara

It's not so much that I want to kill him. It's just, I want him not to be alive. Anymore.


Hugs, kisses, and blah!, Sara

Brightest
Copeland

If you find yourself here on my side of town
I'd pray that you'd come to my door
Talk to me like you don't know what we ever fought about
Cause I don't remember anymore
I just know that she warms my heart
And knows what all my imperfections are
And she said that I was the brightest little firefly in her jar

And I just know that she warms my heart
And knows what all my imperfections are
And she says that I am the brightest little firefly in her jar

I put this up on a pedestal. And for what? It's sad. It's not a love song. It's a song about infatuation. And loss. Two things I don't want in my life. Because I'm moving on to better things. Things that don't involve this song or anyone or anything associated with it.

You Know Me Better Than That
George Straight

Baby since you left me I've found someone new
She thinks I'm perfect I swear
She likes my body, my class, and my charm
She says I've got a confident air
She respects my ambition, thinks I'm talented too
But she's in love with an image time is bound to see through

Chorus:
You know me better than that
You know the me that gets lazy and fat
How moody I can be
All my insecurities
You've seen me lose all my charm
You know I was raised on a farm
Oh she tells her I'm perfect
And that I love her cat
But you know me better than that

I miss picnics and blue jeans and buckets of beer
Now it's ballet and symphony hall
I'm in culture clean up to my ears
It's like wearn' a shoe that's too small
Oh I caught her with an issue of brides magazine
Starin' at dresses and pickin' out rings

Repeat Chorus

Oh she tells her friends I'm perfect
And that I love that cat
Oh, but you know me better than that

I'm done. Literally and figuratively.


Hugs, kisses, and I'm so past 'Face' that it's almost disappointing, Sara

The next time around I will...

Tell him I think he's soooo amazing.
Tell him why I think he's sooooooo amazing.

Talk (yell) cute things at him at shows!!
Tickle him to death 'till he is about to pee his pants.
He'll scream and fight me but secretly, he`ll love it.

Hold his hand and skip
Hold his hand and run.
Just hold his hand.

Tell him he's amazingly adorable.

Introduce him to my friends
as the most wonderful person I know.

Sit in the park and talk to him.
JUST TALK TO HIM.
Take him to the movies...
TAKE HIM ANYWHERE.

TELL HIM HAPPY STORIES.
TELL HIM SAD STORIES.
TELL HIM ANYTHING.
TELL HIM EVERYTHING. 
Tell him stupid jokes.

Write silly little poems about him.
Just walk with him.

When he starts to catch an attitude,
tell him I love him.
Take him to shows of
bands hes never heard of.
Hold his hand in the mosh pit (maybe not).

Call him.
Call him back if he calls me.
Sing to him... lalalalalalalala!
no matter how
badly I sing.

Go see his band play and even if it sucks,
tell him it was GREAT!

Give him space if he needs it.
Push him on swings.
Stay up with him all night when he's sick.
Make up pet names for him..
cute ones, not sappy ones.

Make him mixtapes.
Write him letters.

Listen to all the bands he mentions.
Won't tell him that his favorite bands suck.

When he's sad,
hang out with him
or stay on the
phone with him,
even if hes not saying anything.

Let him take all the photos
of me he wants.... even if i look like CRAP!
Look into his eyes.
Slow dance with him,
even if the music is fast.

TELL HIM A SECRET.
Kiss him in the rain.
JUST KISS HIM.

TRUST HIM.

LOVE HIM.

BE MYSELF AROUND HIM.

CHERISH HIM.

and... 

when I fall in love... 

I'll tell him.

<3 

Hugs, kisses, and what I should do from now on, Sara

It's safe to say that my time at Cornerstone has been the best of my life.

And it's still not over.

I'm in a hotel in Bushnell right now. A long hot shower was needed after using Wet Wipes to "bathe" in the tent since Sunday. Plus, I caught a horrible cold. Still, nothing beats this.

God has truly blessed me with this experience.

I love being here with some of the people I care most for. I love having met so many new people. I love reaching out and praising God in so many different ways here. That's the best part about this whole thing. That's why I came. And I am so thankful for it.

Widows&Orphans played today. They did AMAZING! The president of Tooth and Nail missed mewithoutyou's set to watch W&O's entired set. I think that's a good sign. Also, two people from Floodgate were there also and have requested a meeting with the band. We're all just not worrying or hoping for anything. They're just going to let God handle it. And breathe easy.

Aaron Weiss is delivering a sermon a few feet away from our tent on Saturday. There is no way I'm going to miss it. I know I'll grow as a Christian just by being around him. He is so inspirational and so in love with God that you can feel it. You can tell that he reaches out to God and tries to praise Him with every breath, with every step... 

Today I saw a boy wearing a shirt with a dinosaur on it. It said, "Extinct. No. You stink!" That made my day and I told everyone about it. They laughed. 

It's 3 AM. I'm gonna go rest and meet up with the rest of me (Anthony) and the boys in a few hours, so I should get some sleep.


Hugs, kisses, and this is happiness, Sara

I don't know why I tried to make it his.

It was always your song.


Hugs, kisses, and being impatient for your friendly smile, Sara

Can we be friends forever?

Like, we're friends now. And that's wonderful. But when forever comes around, will we still be just like we are now?

I hope so.

Because I love you.


Hugs, kisses, and hopes and dreams, Sara

* Tomorrow is Michael's 5th birthday!

THURSDAY: 
- Fly out to Round Rock in the morning.
- Have dinner with Anthony's parents.
- Go on a date with Anthony.

FRIDAY:
- Run tons of errands for the wedding.
- Wedding rehearsal dinner.
- 'Sex and the City' special.

SATURDAY:
- Get my hair done in the morning.
- Go to AJ and Joy's wedding!
- See Anthony be Best Man.
- Dance and eat cake.
- Spend time with Anthony's parents.

SUNDAY:
- Drive back home with Colin and Antony.
- Attend my little brother's 5th birthday party in the afternoon.
- Spend time with Anthony in the Valley.

Hugs, kisses, and having an exciting weekend coming up, Sara

I get into this year's Cornerstone Festival absolutely free.

With a backstage pass.

Baby.


Hugs, kisses, and waiting for July, Sara

1. You are in the Witness Protection Program and must invent a new first, last, and middle name.
Miss Soma Cate Hepburn

2. You are in a threesome with two famous people, alive or dead.
These people wouldn't be really DEAD ...u know...WHILST having the threesome, right?? Well, I pick live people anyway...the two songwriters... Conor Oberst and Tim Kasher OR Conor Oberst and Johnny Rzeznik

3. You are in charge of naming your new band. What's the name of the band?
An all girl band called 'Ruby Red Slippers'

4. You are going to get a free tattoo. What is it and where do you want it?
I'd probobly get my next tattoo project done... wings!

5. You are being forced to listen to one song over and over, ad infinitum, as a form of torture. What song is it?
I'd shoot myself in the face if I had to listen to 'The Sound of Settling' by Death Cab for Cutie more than a few times.

6. You are leaving your state/province. What state do you move to?
If I can't live in Texas, I'm moving back to England!

7. You are leaving your country, where would you move to?
England, Italy, or Mexico

8. You get to choose one book as the best ever written. What book do you choose?
Worst question EVER! If I had to chose just ONE book... it would be the one I read most often... the Holy Bible!

9. You get to choose one movie as the best ever made. What movie do you choose?
I can't think of a movie I love that much, except for... 'Beauty and the Beast!' 

10. You get to spend one day each as a bird, an insect, and a mammal. What bird would you be? What insect? What mammal?
I'd be a hummingbird, a butterfly, and an elephant.

11. You must relive one year of your life. Which would you like to relive? 
Last year. I felt the love in 2005.

12. Which would you least like to relive?
My sophomore year in high school. I hate you, 2001!

13. You have a time machine that will take you backwards anywhere from 1800 to the present. What decade do you most want to visit?
The 1960s, 1970s... peace, love, and rock 'n roll, baby. plus, the amazing music at the time!

14. You must choose to go skydiving or very-deep-sea diving.
Skydiving!

15. You get to return to the past and have a sexual encounter with a rock star who is no longer alive. Who do you pick?
George Harrison? John Lennon? Johnny Cash? Elvis? Kurt Cobain? Haha... I'm a return-to-the-past-and-have-a-sexual-encounter-with-a-rockstar slut.

16. You get to be a contestant on any game show, airing today or in the past. What show do you want to be on?
'The Price is Right'?

17. You are given $1 million dollars but you must give it all to one charity. What charity do you choose?
Any charity helping with the AIDS epidemic in Africa.

18. You must ban one word from the dictionary and all usage, to be no longer uttered or written. What word do you ban?
'Cunt.' Yes, it's in there.

19. You can have 100 million dollars tax free but if you take it, you'll die at the age of fifty. Do you take it?
No


I really want to talk to Anthony right now. Badly. To ask him the silly questions in this survey! But alas, he's traveling, so I'll squeeze as many as I can during our 'goodnight' phone call.

I'll call Victor.


Hugs, kisses, and why do I have the Blood Brothers in my head?, Sara

" That's how bad things really are.

That's crap. Nothing has ever been that bad. If it is, I'm sorry, but it's your own damn fault. Stop drinking so much and talk to God, you potzers... Give your LJ a break for a night, and pick up ye ole' Bible. You'll feel better when it's over, I promise.

Trust.

Me. "

Michael Foulk makes me dance.


Hugs, kisses, and unicorns are real... they're just all dead, Sara

Last night, I slept in a Sara sandwich. It went, CHANEL LAPOO - ME - ANTHONY, and it was grand.

Tonight, I'm sleeping alone, because Anthony is taking off to Austin tomorrow, and Chanel LaPoo has a newfound love for killing opposums, and keeps doing it nightly. Yeah. Poodles who kill opposums are not allowed in my room.

The show on Wednesday was great. I had all my close friends in one small, hot, smokey place. I danced with Michael, played movie trivia with Isaac and Anthony, got my face saved by Leslie, and shared laughs with everyone afterwards at my birthday party.

I felt loved.

And for that, I am thankful.

My Jesus loves me.

It's insane to think that He loves me (and you) as if we were the only person in the world.

Insane in a good way.

My love for my Jesus, my friends, my family, and Anthony feels like it's going to explode out of me.

On a much lesser note: I have been obssessed with wings (like the kind birds have, not the kind you eat) since I saw X3. My first thought out of the theatre was, 'I want my boyfriend to have wings.' I'm thinking of getting wings tattooed on my back. Above my back piece. Not huge, but small wings that are proportionate to my back. I'm still pondering on this idea... I don't know if I'll be as enthustiastic about my wings when I'm 40. Or 60. Or 22 even. I'll pray about it and see what God wants me to do.


Hugs, kisses, and love, love, love, Sara

My new hair. It will be blonder by next week (my birthday!). On the phone with this guy... That was right before he gashed his head open. But more on that later... X-Men 3 was AMAZING! I want my boyfriend to have wings... Hugs, kisses, and Storm owns, Sara

"Death, you are my bitch lover!"

Hugs, kisses, and this is soooo funny to me, Sara

I have ANOTHER funeral to go to tomorrow.

Second one in three days.

This one's going to hurt.

But the first one was worse, I think.

Either way, Anthony's coming down to be with me.

Then we're going to Austin for a show and a festival that he's playing at.

So that should be helpful.


Hugs, kisses, and I'm glad I have pleny of black clothing, Sara

* Thomas is my best friend. And I love him. Because we talk and laugh and hug. And that means the world to me.

Today I attended the most solemn of human rituals.

A funeral.

My good friend, Myra's, older sister, Maggie, died in a very serious car accident.

She was a loving wife, sister, daughter, and friend. She was a registered nurse who worked in home healthcare. She died going from one patient to another.

I went to a Catholic mass that was intended, I think, to comfort the family. A mosquito was biting my ankles the entire time. Although I am not Catholic, I used to be, and I felt a peace being in a Catholic church during a Catholic ceremony.

As I sat in the pew at the church, I saw people filing into the church. A lot of them were fellow nurses who worked with Maggie. They all wore purple scrubs. The church was almost filled with family and friends.

I wondered if that many people would go to my service when I died. How much of my family would attend? Would it only be my immediate family? Would few friends come?

I always figured that the amount of people who go to a person's funeral is a good indication of how many lives that person touched during their life. 

I wonder if I do. I've always figured that you're on Earth to do God's will until He needs you in Heaven. What if I'm doing a crappy job of that?

I hope that when I die, that no one cries. Because really, dying is the best thing that could happen to a person. God is choosing you to come home. He's singling you out of tons of people, because He's prepared a room for you in Heaven and feels that you're perfect enough to join Him.

Of course, it feels crappy to lose someone. I'm not afraid to die, but I know I'd be homesick for my family and close friends. Even in Heaven.

I'm not going out of my way to die or anything, but I'm not afraid of it. When my Father wants me to come home, I'll be looking foward to going. There will be a party up in Heaven for me. And I know God knows me well enough to make it pink. With poodles.


Hugs, kisses, and just relflecting, Sara

It took three tries to get a decent Mother's Day picture. She's not looking... She's licking... Perfect! I hope everyone's having a Happy Mother's Day. Show your mama some love! Hugs, kisses, and your mama is a llama, Sara

Wanna be friends? Here are some pictures of Anthony and me at SPI: Taco Bell Love Hahahaha! The most homosexual fip-flops ever! My birthday is coming up. And the boys are playing a show on the following day for me. That made me happy. I love all five of them, but Anthony the most. I'd really like it if my friends came down and helped me celebrate my 21st birthday. Please? Thanks! I love Leslie and Thomas! Hugs, kisses, and I want a pet tiger, Sara

I'm pretty much harmless.

Unless you get me really pissed and are short enough for me to reach... I'll break your nose. With my palm. 'Cause I'm a ninja.

Baby.

I'm headed to Austin this weekend for some friend time. And 'Silent Hill.'

Anthony will be moving to the Valley for a few weeks. Yay!

He let me know that he'll be proposing soon.


Hugs, kisses, and wishing everyone love, Sara

Anthony and I got into a big fight.

Both of us feel that the other person is too good for us and we don't deserve them.

We cried, screamed, and cursed about loving each other too much... for two hours.

It's ridiculous.

People do the craziest things when they're in love.


Hugs, kisses, and loving this boy unconditionally and beyond, Sara

... then making this made me feel better. Anthony is going on tour in four days. He'll be gone for a month or so. The idea of him being on tour again made me sad, so I got some pictures that a fan of theirs sent me, and he looked so happy playing, that I felt selfish for feeling bad, and now I'm happy that he's going to go around the country making music and spreading God's love. God has blessed me with such a great relationship. And I am so thankful. Anthony and I are both praying that God will make us perfect for each other in every way possible. And nothing is more right than that. Oh, and my boyfriend's hott... And here are some of those pictures: Smile. Look. Leg. Back. Hugs, kisses, and loving the boy in blue, Sara

"Wednesday, April 12, 2006

  im going to miss her more then she knows 

so i left the valley for today and it hit me that this is the longest i have been apart from sara since we have really been together and its going to be hard as crap, but i know God is going to us both of us for great things and i also know he is going to reward me by bringing back to her so i can have peace in that. he knows the desires of my heart and that desire is sara and of course i have faith that he can bring me threw this seperation. because only he knows how much i love her!!!

sara if you read this i love you more then i thought possible."
 

Hugs, kisses, and being completely in love with Anthony Kroeker, Sara

A tricky one, I am.

And I love my Anthony Kroeker. MY Anthony Kroeker. MINE.

This has no point.

And that's cool.

It's called euphoria.


Hugs, kisses, and Boi Miller is on the floor playing with toy cars, Sara

I feel like Alice falling down the rabbit hole.

Every single day that passes, I fall deeper in love with Anthony.

And that is brilliant.

At the end of "Alice in Wonderland," Alice wakes up and realizes that her whole adventure was just a dream.

I hope that I don't wake up ever.

Or that when I do, everything is purple.


Hugs, kisses, and Miss K., Sara

Haha.
He got fat.
And I'm NOT talking about my boyfriend.
[Bitch moment over... now!]

Anthony will be here for over a week this time. That's wonderful! 

We should hang out! I'm talking to you, Collin! 

I should stock up on Dr. Pepper for him. Actually, he needs to stop that. Danitza made a good point earlier when she said that he should start drinking more water to avoid kidney stones later in life. I'm planning on being there 'later in life,' and really don't want to deal with that, so we need to start drinking the H2O.

But according to Anthony, life is composed of Dr. Pepper, cigarettes, and BBQs. He is such a redneck. I'm dating a hillbilly hick. And that makes life so much more interesting.

I'm talking to my friend, Jessica. Anthony's fell asleep on her living room floor next to Scott and Colin playing video games. Why do I find that do endearing? I must have it bad for this boy. And that's totally okay!

OH! When he was here two weeks ago, he was super enthused about buying a 'gangsta' hat. He's was like, "how rock and roll would it be to wear a gangsta hat?" Okay, whatever. We went to the mall and bought a gangsta hat. All black with a 'D' on it. We have no clue what the 'D' stands for, but there you go. Anyway, I was under agreement to him buying the hat, because I figured he'd use it sparingly as an accessory. I was wrong. He won't take the hat off. And I hate it. He thinks he looks so cool with the hat. I mean, he looks great, but I love his hair, and miss seeing it. Jessica, his best friend, has also expressed concern over that hat. She hates it. So this week when he's here, I'm taking the hat. Jessica thinks that he wears it because he thinks I like it. I don't like the hat. The hat is going down.

I'm meeting all of Anthony's friends tomorrow. They're all getting together at Jessica's house to meet me. I feel special. Anthony says not to worry. He says they'll love me. I'm not too worried. He loves me and that's all that matters.

There you go.


Hugs, kisses, and rednecks can't pull of 'gangsta,' Sara
I got my septum pierced. My boys like to relax (i.e. be lazy). Anthony and I look super cute when we wake up. I love him. Hugs, kisses, and ♥, Sara

I talked to Anthony about how weird I was feeling about him coming over. He made me feel better. Somewhat. Either way, I'll be asleep next to him this time tomorrow night. Michael and Anthony last night. I really hate his plugs. So much. But I'll deal. Hugs, kisses, and being scared about tomorrow, Sara

Is this what anxiety feels like?

I'm human. But he doesn't need to know that.

He'll find out tomorrow, though.

He's going to find out that his girlfriend is sooo much shorter than he is. She's clumsy, gets zits, drools while she's sleeping, is a terrible morning person, can't ice skate, and talks during movies. 

I'm being completely irrational.

I think I need a nap.

Or to go pijama pant shopping. 

So at least I'll look kind of cute while I'm drooling on his shoulder.


Hugs, kisses, and plenty of 'ugh's, Sara

Today was such a random day.

Those are my favorites.

I...
- dyed my hair. 
- dyed Isaac's hair. Twice.
- got called an airhead by my boyfriend ("You're not one, but you sound like one sometimes"). Isaac and my mother agreed. I threw a fit, and the pointed out the airhead-ness in that. So I stopped.
- saw the most gruesome and disturbing movie ever with Isaac, Denise, and Benny. 'The Hills Have Eyes' was beyond insane. Isaac and I left the theatre super stressed out and needed to relax afterwards, which we did at IHOP.

Today was great.

Tomorrow I'm getting the oil changed in my car.

And Monday, Isaac and I are off to Austin.

Anyone wanna join us on a roadtrip? Lol...


Hugs, kisses, and loving a boy named Isaac tons, Sara
